item.title: Basic terms in the probability theory
item.description: Basic terms in probability theory are outcomes, sample space, events, and probability measure. Outcomes and sample space . When you conduct a random experiment, there is a set of possible results of this experiment. This results are called outcomes. All possible outcomes together form a set, which is called sample space. It is customary to denote outcomes with \(\omega\) and sample space with \(\Omega\): \[ \Omega = \{ \omega \text{ such that } \omega \text{ is an outcome of random experiment} \}.

item.title: Borel σ-algebra
item.description: When one studies probability theory, a notion of a Borel $σ$-algebra arises. Here we will look at what this is. First thing is to understand what $σ$-algebra means.
